parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1
Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.STUDYID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
fields.implementationNotes: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
fields.label: Study Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: STUDYID
fields.questionText: What is the study identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.SITEID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.
fields.label: Study Site Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SITEID
fields.questionText: What is the site identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.SUBJID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
fields.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.
fields.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SUBJID
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99079

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.EPOCH

fields.completionInstructions: [protocol specific]
fields.definition: Name of the Trial Epoch with which this Element of the Arm is associated.
fields.implementationNotes: If the same information is collected more than once in different periods/parts of a study (e.g., Disposition), EPOCH may be needed to differentiate them. Typically, the trial epoch will be preprinted on the CRF as the title of the page. See SDTMIG for further information regarding EPOCH.
fields.label: Epoch
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: EPOCH
fields.questionText: What is the trial epoch?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECYN

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if the subject took any study medications. If Yes, include the appropriate details where indicated.
fields.definition: An indication whether or not the subject took study medication/ treatment.
fields.implementationNotes: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank. The ECYN is meant to indicate that the exposure as collected form should be completed or inserted into the case book. ECOCCUR would be used when the actual drug name is preprinted on the CRF. While these might be equivalent in a single drug study, there are differences in how they would be used in most trials. Therefore, it does not map into the SDTM variable ECOCCUR, since ECOCCUR indicates whether the subject was actually administered treatment/medication. If actual treatment data is available (ECYN ="Y"), ECOCCUR may be populated based on whether subject was actually administered treatment/medication.
fields.label: Any Study Treatment Taken
fields.mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM aCRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
fields.name: ECYN
fields.questionText: Were any[study treatment/dose] taken?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the study treatment category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Category of Treatment
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: ECCAT
fields.questionText: What is the category of the [study treatment/dose]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECSCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the study treatment subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A sub-division of the ECCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be preprinted on the CRF or screen and prepopulated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. ECSCAT can only be used if there is an ECCAT and it must be a subcategorization of ECCAT.
fields.label: Subcategory of Treatment
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: ECSCAT
fields.questionText: What is the subcategory of the [study treatment/dose]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECTRT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the name of study treatment.
fields.definition: Name of the intervention or treatment known to the subject and/or administrator.
fields.implementationNotes: ECTRT is the name of the intervention or treatment known to the subject and/or administrator and it is the SDTM topic variable. It is a required variable in SDTM and must have a value in CDASH or a plan to populate it in the SDTM submission datasets (i.e., collected or populated from other sources). In a masked study, if treatment is collected and known as Tablet A to the subject or administrator, then ECTRT="TABLET A". If in a masked study the treatment is not known by a synonym and the data are to be exchanged between sponsors, partners and/or regulatory agency(s), then assign ECTRT the value of "MASKED".
fields.label: Treatment
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: ECTRT
fields.questionText: What was the [study treatment/investigational product] name?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECPRESP

fields.definition: An indication that a specific intervention or a group of interventions is prespecified on a CRF.
fields.implementationNotes: For prespecified interventions, a hidden field on a CRF defaulted to "Y", or added during the SDTM dataset creation. If a study collects both prespecified interventions as well as free-text interventions, the value of ECPRESP should be "Y" for all prespecified interventions and null for interventions reported as free-text.
fields.label: Exposure as Collected Pre-Specified
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: ECPRESP

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECOCCUR

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if the subject took study treatment. If Yes, include the appropriate details where indicated.
fields.definition: An indication whether the study treatment was administered when information about the occurrence of a specific intervention is solicited.
fields.implementationNotes: ECOCCUR is used to indicate whether the subject was actually administered treatment/medication. ECOCCUR should not be used to indicate that the question was not asked or answered.
fields.label: Exposure as Collected Occurrence
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. Not applicable when ECMOOD is "Scheduled".
fields.name: ECOCCUR
fields.questionText: Was [study treatment/dose] administered?; Has the subject taken [study treatment/dose]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECREASOC

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate why the study treatment was or wasnot taken.
fields.definition: An explanation of why a scheduled study treatment administration did or did not occur.
fields.implementationNotes: The reason the study treatment was or was not taken may be chosen from a sponsor-defined codelist (e.g., SUBJECT MISTAKE, SUBJECT REFUSED) or entered as free text. When --REASOC is used, --OCCUR must also be populated in the SDTM dataset with a value of "Y" or "N".
fields.label: Exposure Reason for Occur Value
fields.mappingInstructions: This information could be submitted in a SUPPEC dataset as the value of SUPPEC.QVAL where SUPPEC.QNAM="ECREASOC" and SUPPEC.QLABEL ="Reason for Occur Value". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: ECREASOC
fields.questionText: What was the reason that the[study treatment/dose] was (not)taken?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C125923

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECMOOD

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate if this record has happened or is intended to happen.
fields.definition: Mode or condition of the record specifying whether the intervention (activity) is intended to happen or has happened.
fields.implementationNotes: "SCHEDULED" is for collected subject-level intended dose records. "PERFORMED" is for collected subject-level actual dose records. "Planned" or "Scheduled" can be pre-printed as the CRF name or section header, as applicable. If collecting both the scheduled and performed dosing in the same horizontal record, the sponsor may choose to append "_SCHEDULED" to the ECDOSE/ECDOSTXT variable name to delineate the scheduled dose from the performed dose. The performed dose would just be collected with ECDOSE/ECDOSTXT and ECDOSU.
fields.label: Exposure as Collected Mood
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. When implemented ECMOOD must be populated for all records.
fields.name: ECMOOD
fields.questionText: Does this record describe scheduled [study treatment/dose] or performed [study treatment/dose]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECREFID

fields.completionInstructions: Record treatment label identifier.
fields.definition: An internal or external identifier such as kit number, bottle label, or vial identifier.
fields.implementationNotes: This packaging identifier (e.g., kit number, bottle label, vial identifier) may be collected in different ways (e.g., affixing label onto CRF, scanning a bar code). For some study dosing regimens, greater granularity for treatment identifiers may be needed. In this situation, sponsors may need to use additional variables.
fields.label: Exposure as Collected Reference ID
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: ECREFID
fields.questionText: What is the[study treatment/dose] label identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECLOT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the lot number that appears on the container holding the study treatment.
fields.definition: Lot Number of the ECTRT product.
fields.implementationNotes: The Lot Number identifies the manufacturing batch of the study treatment. In open-label studies, the reference number on the study treatment container may represent an actual Lot Number and should be submitted using ECLOT. This variable may be populated during the process of creating the SDTM submission datasets. Do not collect other identification variables in this field.
fields.label: Lot Number
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: ECLOT
fields.questionText: What was the lot number of the[study treatment/dose] used?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECFAST

fields.completionInstructions: Record whether the subject was fasting prior to the study treatment being taken.
fields.definition: An indication that the subject has abstained from food/water for the specified amount of time.
fields.implementationNotes: Some study treatments may have a food effect and it is important to know whether the dose was taken while the subject was fasted.
fields.label: Exposure as Collected Fasting Status
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. Would only be populated when ECMOOD="PERFORMED".
fields.name: ECFAST
fields.questionText: Was the subject fasting?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66726
Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78426

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECDOSFRM

fields.completionInstructions: Record the dose form (e.g., SOLUTION, TABLET, LOTION) or enter the appropriate code from the code list.
fields.definition: The dosage form in which the ECTRT is physically presented
fields.implementationNotes: This must be collected if it cannot be determined from other sources or if there are multiple options for the same study treatment.
fields.label: Exposure as Collected Dose Form
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: ECDOSFRM
fields.questionText: What was the dose form of the [study treatment/dose]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECSTDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the start date of the study treatment administration using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The start date of study treatment, intended or actual, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: Date when constant dosing interval of the study treatment started or single administration occurred. When collecting the date for an individual dose, the word "start" may be omitted from the Question Text and Prompt. When ECMOOD is collected and ECMOOD is "SCHEDULED", use "intended" in the question text and prompt. When ECMOOD is collected and ECMOOD is "PERFORMED", use "actual" in the question text and prompt.
fields.label: Exposure as Collected Start Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable ECSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: ECSTDAT
fields.questionText: What was the ([intended/planned/actual]) ([study treatment/dose]) (start) date?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECSTTIM

fields.completionInstructions: Record the start time (as complete as possible) when administration of study treatment started.
fields.definition: The start time of study treatment, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: Recommend collecting the time a medication was started only when a protocol or data collection scenarios requires it. When collecting the time for an individual dose, the word "start" may be omitted from the Question Text and Prompt.
fields.label: Exposure as Collected Start Time
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable ECSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: ECSTTIM
fields.questionText: What was the ([intended/planned/actual]) ([study treatment/dose]) (start) time?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECENDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the end date of the study treatment administration using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The end date of study treatment, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: Date when study treatment period stopped.If start date and end date are not expected to be on the same date, the collection of the end date is required. If the study design indicates that the start and end date are on the same day, the collection of the end date is not required because it can be assigned to be equal to the start date.
fields.label: Exposure as Collected End Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable ECENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: ECENDAT
fields.questionText: What was the ([intended/planned/actual]) ([study treatment/dose]) (end) date?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECENTIM

fields.completionInstructions: Record the time, (as complete as possible) when study treatment administration stopped (e.g., for infusions this is the time when the infusion ended).
fields.definition: The end time of study treatment, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: Recommend collecting the time a medication was ended when a protocol or data collection scenarios requires it. For infusions, the end time of the infusion is typically needed.
fields.label: Exposure as Collected End Time
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable ECENDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: ECENTIM
fields.questionText: What was the ([intended/planned/actual]) ([study treatment/dose]) (end) time?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECDSTXT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the dose or amount of study treatment that was administered to/taken by the subject in the period recorded; from the start date/time to the end date/time inclusive.
fields.definition: The dose of study medication taken (per administration).
fields.implementationNotes: Dose or amount taken for single administration of study treatment or per constant dosing interval recorded. Dose must be collected if it cannot be determined via other methods (e.g., from diary data, drug accountability data, protocol). Care should be taken when mapping ECDSTXT. The data collected in this dose text-format field should be separated or mapped to either ECDOSE if numeric or ECDOSTXT if text.
fields.label: Exposure as Collected Dose Description
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. The data collected in this dose text-format field should be mapped to either ECDOSE if numeric or ECDOSTXT if text.
fields.name: ECDSTXT
fields.questionText: What was the dose (per administration) (of [study treatment/dose])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620
Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78423

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECDOSU

fields.completionInstructions: Record the unit of dose or amount taken per period recorded (e.g., ng, mg, mg/kg).
fields.definition: The unit for intended dose (per administration) for ECDOSE, ECDOSTOT, or ECDOSTXT.
fields.implementationNotes: Unit of dose or amount taken per constant dosing interval recorded. Dose unit must be collected if it cannot be determined via other methods (e.g., determined from protocol, randomization data). The unit should be preprinted on the CRF or a field provided on the CRF to capture it. A CDASH Subset Controlled Terminology Codelist Name is available for dose and volume units. In blinded trials, the collected unit may be tablet, capsule, etc., since the actual unit is also blinded.
fields.label: Exposure as Collected Dose Units
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: ECDOSU
fields.questionText: What were the units for the dose?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71113
Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78745

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECDOSFRQ

fields.completionInstructions: Record the frequency the study treatment was administered for a defined period of time (e.g., BID, QID, TID).
fields.definition: The number of doses given/administered/taken during a specific interval.
fields.implementationNotes: This may be collected if it cannot be determined from other sources or if there are multiple options. When possible, the options for dose/amount frequency are pre-printed on the CRF. When collected, the recommendation is to collect dosing information in separate fields (e.g., ECDOSE, ECDOSEU, ECDOSFRQ) for specific and consistent data collection and to enable programmatically utilizing these data.
fields.label: EC Dosing Frequency per Interval
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: ECDOSFRQ
fields.questionText: What was the frequency of [study treatment/dose] dosing?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66729
Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78425

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECROUTE

fields.completionInstructions: Record the route of administration (e.g., IV, ORAL, TRANSDERMAL) or enter the appropriate code from the code list.
fields.definition: The route of administration of the study treatment.
fields.implementationNotes: This may be collected if it cannot be determined via other methods (e.g., from protocol) or if there are multiple options.
fields.label: EC Route of Administration
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: ECROUTE
fields.questionText: What was the route of administration (of the [study treatment/dose])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECDOSRGM

fields.completionInstructions: Record the regimen for the study medication.
fields.definition: The text description of the (intended) schedule or regimen for the Intervention.
fields.implementationNotes: The regimen information (e.g., TWO WEEKS ON, TWO WEEKS OFF) may further clarify the dose administration and dose frequency. This may be preprinted or collected. The sponsor may wish to create a codelist to collect this data consistently.
fields.label: Intended Dose Regimen
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: ECDOSRGM
fields.questionText: What was the intended dose regimen?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECDOSADJ

fields.completionInstructions: Select either Yes or No to indicate whether there was a change in dosing.
fields.definition: An indication whether or not the dose was adjusted.
fields.implementationNotes: Typically, the intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring as it provides a definitive response regarding any dose changes. It provides verification that the associate field on the CRF (ECADJ) was deliberately left blank. However, the sponsor may collect whether the dose was adjusted, without collecting the reason for the change. When using ECMOOD, this field should not be used.
fields.label: Dose Adjusted
fields.mappingInstructions: When ECADJ is collected, does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM Annotated CRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED. When ECADJ is not collected, the sponsor may submit this variable in SUPPEC.
fields.name: ECDOSADJ
fields.questionText: Was the dose adjusted?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECADJ

fields.completionInstructions: If there was a change in dosing, record the reason for change.
fields.definition: Description or explanation of why a dose of the study treatment is adjusted.
fields.implementationNotes: Captures the reason the dose was changed or modified. The reason may be chosen from a sponsor-defined list (e.g., adverse event, insufficient response) or entered as free text. May be used for variations from protocol-specified doses, or changes from expected doses. Used only when an adjustment is represented in EX dataset.
fields.label: Reason for Dose Adjustment
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: ECADJ
fields.questionText: What was the reason the dose was adjusted?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECITRPYN

fields.completionInstructions: Record if there was an interruption in the study treatment or dosing.
fields.definition: An indication whether of not the exposure was interrupted.
fields.implementationNotes: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring when the actual duration of the exposure is collected using the CDASH field ECCINTD. In some situations, if the actual duration of the interruption is not collected, or not derived, this information could be submitted in a SUPPEC.QVAL dataset where SUPPEC.QNAM = "ECITRPYN" and SUPPEC.QLABEL = "Exposure Interrupted".
fields.label: EC Exposure Interrupted
fields.mappingInstructions: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTMIG Annotated CRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.
fields.name: ECITRPYN
fields.questionText: Was the [(study) treatment/dose] interrupted?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECCINTD

fields.completionInstructions: Record the duration of treatment interruption.
fields.definition: The collected duration of the treatment interruption.
fields.implementationNotes: This field is used to collect the duration of treatment interruption. In some situations, the duration of the interruption may not be collected but calculated from the treatment start and end times recorded elsewhere in the CRF.
fields.label: EC Interruption Duration
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPEC dataset as the value of SUPPEC.QVAL where SUPPEC.QNAM="ECITRPD" and SUPPEC.QLABEL= "Interruption Duration". Concatenate the collected treatment interruption duration and the duration unit components and create ECITRPD using ISO 8601 Period format. Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: ECCINTD
fields.questionText: What was the duration of the treatment interruption?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECCINTDU

fields.completionInstructions: Record the unit (e.g., MINUTES, HOURS, DAYS) for the duration of treatment interruption.
fields.definition: The unit for the collected duration of treatment interruption.
fields.implementationNotes: The unit should be collected as a qualifier to the number for duration.
fields.label: EC Interruption Duration Units
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPEC dataset as the value of SUPPEC.QVAL where SUPPEC.QNAM = "ECITRPD" and SUPPEC.QLABEL= "Interruption Duration". Concatenate the collected treatment interruption duration and the duration unit components and create ECITRPD using ISO 8601 Period format. Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: ECCINTDU
fields.questionText: What was the interruption duration unit?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C74456

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECLOC

fields.completionInstructions: Record the body location where the study treatment was administered (e.g., SHOULDER, HIP, ARM).
fields.definition: A description of the anatomical location of administration.
fields.implementationNotes: Collected or preprinted when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location where the study treatment was administered. LAT, DIR, PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.
fields.label: EC Location of Dose Administration
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: ECLOC
fields.questionText: What was the anatomical location of the ([study treatment/dose]) administration?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99073

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECLAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the side of the body location where the study treatment was administered (e.g., Left, Right).
fields.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing side of the body for the study treatment administration.
fields.implementationNotes: Further details the laterality of the location where the study treatment was administered. This may be preprinted or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Exposure as Collected Laterality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: ECLAT
fields.questionText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the ([study treatment/dose]) administration?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99074

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECDIR

fields.completionInstructions: Record the directionality of the body location where the study treatment was administered (e.g., Anterior, Lower, Proximal, Upper).
fields.definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
fields.implementationNotes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: Exposure as Collected Directionality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: ECDIR
fields.questionText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the ([study treatment/dose]) administration?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECVAMT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the total amount (treatment +vehicle) that was administered/given to the subject.
fields.definition: The amount of the prepared product (treatment + vehicle) administered or given.
fields.implementationNotes:
Administration amount that was given to the subject. 
 Note: should not be the diluent amount alone. The ECTRTV field may be collected if it cannot be determined from other sources.
fields.label: EC Vehicle Amount
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. The SDTM variable ECTRTV may also be populated during the process of creating the SDTM submission datasets.
fields.name: ECVAMT
fields.questionText: What was the total amount (Drug + Vehicle) (of [study treatment/dose]) administered?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECVAMTU

fields.completionInstructions: Record the unit of total amount (treatment +vehicle) administered/given to the subject (e.g., mL).
fields.definition: The unit of measurement for the prepared product (treatment + vehicle).
fields.implementationNotes: Unit of the administration amount.
fields.label: EC Vehicle Amount Units
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: ECVAMTU
fields.questionText: What was the unit for the amount (of [study treatment/dose]) administered?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECFLRT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the Rate of Infusion (e.g., if rate is 10 mL/min. Record 10 as the infusion rate).
fields.definition: The flow rate for the total amount of drug + vehicle administered to the subject.
fields.implementationNotes: Infusion rate can be used to derive dose.
fields.label: Exposure as Collected Infusion Rate
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPEC dataset as the value of SUPPEC.QVAL where SUPPEC.QNAM="ECFLRT" and SUPPEC.QLABEL= "Infusion Rate". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: ECFLRT
fields.questionText: What was the [study treatment/dose] infusion rate?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECFLRTU

self.title: Exposure as Collected Infusion Rate Unit

fields.completionInstructions: Record the unit for the infusion rate (e.g., mL/min).
fields.definition: The unit of measure for the flow rate for the total amount of drug + vehicle administered to the subject.
fields.implementationNotes: Unit of the infusion rate.
fields.label: Exposure as Collected Infusion Rate Unit
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPEC dataset as the value of SUPPEC.QVAL where SUPPEC.QNAM="ECFLRTU" and SUPPEC.QLABEL= "Infusion Rate Unit". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: ECFLRTU
fields.questionText: What was the unit for the ([study treatment/dose]) infusion rate?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECTPT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the planned time point of study treatment administration if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.
fields.implementationNotes: Planned time points are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as Planned Time Point can be included as the column header.
fields.label: EC Planned Time Point Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. See SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. The SDTMIG time point anchors ECTPTREF (text description) and ECRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables ECTPTNUM, ECELTM.
fields.name: ECTPT
fields.questionText: What was the planned time point for [study treatment/dose]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field EC.ECTRTCMP

fields.completionInstructions: Select either Yes or No to indicate whether subject has completed the full course of treatment.
fields.definition: An indication whether the subject completed the intended regimen.
fields.implementationNotes: Depending on how the study treatment details are collected via the CRF/eCRF, it may be possible to derive those data if the regimen data are collected.
fields.label: Completed Treatment
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPEC dataset as the value of SUPPEC.QVAL where SUPPEC.QNAM = "ECTRTCMP" and SUPPEC.QLABEL ="Completed Treatment". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: ECTRTCMP
fields.questionText: Did the subject complete the full course of [study treatment/dose]?
